availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Huston Chapman (Union County, Kentucky, clerk)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, clerk. Morganfield, Union County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas S. Chapman and P. F. Chapman. Married to Anne C. Taylor Chapman in Union County, Kentucky, on July 21, 1857. Father of Ella B. Chapman. Student in Union County in 1850. Deputy county clerk in Morganfield in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Morganfield in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 1, p. 457B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield, p. 527.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield, p. 416A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562203, p. 415 of 517 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Thomas H. Chapman (1836-1890)," Memorial #106725653, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106725653 (accessed January 16, 2020).
